channel.title: BCEL - retrieve 'full' static field
channel.description:
I have a field that accesses a field from another class via getstatic.
But when I retrieve the field's name, it returns the field's name without the precedence of the class.
For example: [code] int a = OtherClass.b; [/code]
When scanning that instruction: [code] ((GETSTATIC)instruction).getFieldName(); //returns 'b', rather than 'OtherClass.b' [/code]
How would I retrieve the field's name with the class preceding it, in this case 'OtherClass.b' rather than simply 'b'?

item.title: BCEL - retrieve 'full' static field
item.dc:creator: @frank frank_
item.description:
@frank wrote:

[quote=“chrisn2323, post:12, topic:259352”]it says its deprecated and you want to use getReferenceName()[/quote]thats why i linked to it, i assumed he can read

[quote=“Uriko, post:13, topic:259352”]That would’ve all been avoided if Cowie` had said ‘And I quote…’[/quote]hes a mod, he shouldnt be completely retarded

Read full topic

item.title: BCEL - retrieve 'full' static field
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

chrisn2323:

it says its deprecated and you want to use getReferenceName()

iirc it’s only deprecated because it will return something other than the name if it is an array, he’s only looking to get a single field, so what does it matter?

Read full topic

item.title: BCEL - retrieve 'full' static field
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

[quote=“Cowie`, post:10, topic:259352”][quote author=Lothy link=topic=342454.msg2647880#msg2647880 date=1233354118]

u dumb fuck it is FIELD NAME… where does it say ‘CLASS AND FIELD NAME’ … why the fuck dont you just read the god damn JVM spec so you understand the terminology and MAYBE even look @ some javadocs? anyway, GETSTATIC inherits from FieldInstruction which inherits the method getClassName(ConstantPoolGen) from FieldOrMethod (poor naming ftl… Member) if you want it to get the classname aswell

You know, that really isn’t called for.

You should know that we don’t tolerate flaming in this community. Calling someone a ‘dumb fuck’ for asking a perfectly reasonable question is grossly inappropriate and completely rude, not to mention that it undermines some of the ideals that this community is based on.
The fact that you’re a moderator only aggravates the offence. I think you should appologise, in this topic, to the original poster.
Anymore posts like this and you’ll be taking a holiday.

I relay a message as it’s said, deal with it.

So who are you posting for? And you forgot your apology.

super_ asked me to post it for him, as he doesn’t want to evade a ban. I also refuse to apologize for something that I was relaying. Don’t shoot the messenger

He has already ban evaded though by creating yet another account, TurkishMuslimHacker. I think he should really just find another forum.

You can apologise or be b& for a few days. Before you speak, Cowie, know that on Moparisthebest everyone, even a king’s messenger, is held accountable for the words of his voice (and the keystrokes of his keyboard).
[/quote]

A ban it is, I refuse to appologize for something that is not mine.[/quote]
So be it.

Read full topic
